page.title: 04POPULATION IN KIP VALLEY
page.content: In this area the{population}is found mainly in the village of Inverkip (pop.2500), and part of a Greenock housing estate called Braeside. In Inverkip the houses along main street are over 100 years old, compared to the Brosely{housing}estate in Braeside which is only three years old. In Inverkip the houses are mainly owner- occupied. In Braeside, in the South West of Greenock, most are rented from the council. In Inverkip many people have come from other areas to retire, so more of the population is of older age. In Braeside it is almost the opposite . Many of the families are young couples and few are old. A very few of the population live in scattered farms.
